title: Update empty receipt section in the expense RHP

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
Coming from this conversation in [migrate](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07NMDKEFMH/p1767873619904629). **Problem:** We've seen many users manually uploading receipts (mostly PDFs) that could have been emailed to receipts@ and scanned/automatically matched with card transactions. **Solution:** Update the empty receipt section of the RHP to educate users on the different routes for adding receipts to Expensify:
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @DylanDylann

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.95-5 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** N/A **Issue reported by:** @trjExpensify **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): FS session ## Action Performed: 1. Create a _Control_ workspace 2. Go to Members > Invite member 3. Select a user > Next ## Expected Result: - Add the Approver row on the confirm details page. Set the entered user as the invitee's submitsTo. Notes: - The row should be populated by default with the workspace's default approver. - It should only appear on `Control` workspaces, because `Collect` workspaces use a single approver for all. - It should only appear when advanced approvals are enabled on the Control workspace, because basic approvals uses a single approver for all. - The members that appear in the select list should follow the same logic as exists in Workflows, no changes there. ## Actual Result: There isn't an Approver field as it stands. ## Workaround: N/A ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos In-line above. title: [$250] Add sticky filters to the reports page

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
Coming from https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07NMDKEFMH/p1767893350163039 We have three main queries for the reports page: - Expenses - Reports - Chats Each of these presets is currently a pre-defined query (IE `type:expense`, `type:expense-report`, etc), which we navigate to when the item is clicked. We want to make each of these presets have a sort of internal-state, allowing the user to navigate away from that preset, and then back to it, while preserving the selected filters. See the example below: - User clicks `Reports > Reports` - User filters by date, and user, while on the reports page - User clicks `Expenses` and gets taken to the expenses view - User changes some filters on the expenses page - User navigates back to the `Reports` Page - The filters on the reports page should be the same as before: date & user
Upwork Automation - Do Not Edit

  • Upwork Job ID: 2009353385635545889
  • Last Price Increase: 2026-01-08
